condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls and boys under five years old and caregivers affected by humanitarian crises have increased and timely access to quality nutrition services in line with UNICEF Core Commitments for Children in Humanitarian Action (CCC)

description.narrative: UNICEF has contributed to prevent increased mortality related to acute malnutrition and improve equitable access to nutrition services in hard to reach areas and at-risk of high food insecurity and malnutrition. Integrated rapid response missions have been conducted in 32 locations to reach 63,750 children (29,899 girls), 47,600 women caregivers and over 11,000 men in hard-to-reach areas reaching 159 percent of the 2019 target. The existence of functional coordination and timely emergency preparedness plan contributed significantly to timely responses to flood affected population through re-establishment of services in high lands, outreach services and resumption of existing nutrition services. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of UNICEF IRRM missions conducted with Nutrition component
